info.description:
**D R A F T --D R A F T --D R A F T -- D R A F T -- D R A F T -- D R A F T**

The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) Blue Button API is a  developer-friendly, standards-based, data API that enables Medicare  beneficiaries to connect their Medicare claims data to the applications,  services, and research programs they trust. 

Up to three years of claims information can be accessed using the  HL7 Fast Health Care interoperability Resource (FHIR) specification.

Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation. 

The **CMS Blue Button API** is keyed by a unique Patient id. This id is  used to apply filter parameters in requests and searches to limit the information returned to that of the logged in user.

In FHIR terms the **Medicare Beneficiary** is the "**Patient**." In order to be  consistent with the FHIR specification we will use the term Patient throughout this documentation to refer to the Medicare Beneficiary.
info.title: CMS Blue Button API (DRAFT)

Bundle.description: A complex object that can contain multiple objects.

Coverage.description: The Coverage resource identifies the Medicare insurance plans the beneficiary is covered by.

ExplanationOfBenefit.description: The ExplanationOfBenefit Resource definition. This details the procedures, services  medicines and equipment that a beneficiary has received as a result of Medicare  coverage. An ExplanationOfBenefit resource will typically contain multiple claim line details. For example a doctor's office visit may identify tests conducted, procedures performed and medications issued.

OperationOutcome.description: An OperationOutcome message is typically issued when there is an issue with a FHIR request. For example when a resource is not supported on the FHIR Server or the search syntax is not understood.

Patient.description:
The Patient Resource definition. Blue Button records are keyed from this resource. A Patient is a Medicare Beneficiary.

This resource covers data about patients/beneficiaries involved in a wide range of health-related activities, including Curative activities, Psychiatric care,  Social services, Nursing and assisted living, Personal health tracking and  exercise data.
  

The data in the resource covers the "__who__" information about the patient. Its attributes are focused on the demographic information necessary to support the administrative, financial, and logistic procedures. A patient record is generally created and maintained by each organization providing care for a patient. A patient receiving care at multiple organizations may therefore have their information  present in multiple patient resources.

parameters.description: The language of the resource

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Persistent identifier for the bundle

parameters.name: composition
parameters.description: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "document" - this is a composition, and this parameter provides access to searches its contents

parameters.description: The ID of the resource

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The first resource in the bundle, if the bundle type is "message" - this is a message header, and this parameter provides access to search its contents

parameters.description: document | message | transaction | transaction-response | batch | batch-response | history | searchset | collection

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description:
The ID of the resource. 
The CMS Blue Button API will override any id entered with the logged in user's fhir_id. This prevents one user making a request for another user's information.
